intro: Dipcadi papillatum, commonly known as the hairy squill, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stem and grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
